page.title: 18LITTLE BYTHAM GARDEN FETE
page.content: The fete is usually held in the Old Rectory garden on a Saturday afternoon in late June or early July. "There were 11 stalls this year. There was a raffle, a cake stall, a book stall, the rifle range, the lucky dip, white elephant stall, and a lot more. Each year the vicar comes out at 3.00 to wish you well. We give money to the vicar's funds. It finishes at 5.00 normally. Most of the things are secondhand but some are new. The best thing is the raffle because you win everything." Another regular amusement is skittles. Heavy wooden "cheeses" are hurled at nine battered old skittles set out in a diamond pattern on a plank square. Bales of straw protect bystanders! In 1985 the fete raised Â£523 for St Medard's church funds.
